habitat_description:
The range extends from southern Ontario, Canada and eastern Michigan to eastern Indiana, southeastern Wisconsin, and Ohio (Ernst and Ernst 2003; Minton 2001; Rossman et al. 1996; Vogt 1981).

This species inhabits riparian zones such as herbaceous wetlands, but also grassland and herbaceous terrestrial habitats. Preferred habitat is characterized by moist and grassy situations; pastures, meadows, margins of lakes and streams in open areas, vacant lots, embankments, and marshes. Also found in urban and suburban environments. Cover is provided by rocks, ground litter, logs, the foundations of abandoned buildings, burrows, and ant mounds (Ernst and Ernst 2003; Harding 1997; Minton 2001; Rossman et al. 1996; Vogt 1981).


NE	-Cover is provided by rocks, ground litter, logs, foundations of old buildings, burrows, and ant mounds, and among other similar surface cover.
